reviews.title: very disappointed
reviews.review_text: I ordered this phone on line and I picked it up. When I went to activate it it said it wasn't able to activate so I used chat and the people from straight talk told me that walmart didn't scan the device and that I had to take it back to walmart to get it scanned so I did but Walmart in store told me that they couldn't scan it. That if you buy them online they can not scan to activate.So I had to get a refund. I am very disappointed. I have ordered several phones and could always get them activated. Not sure whats going on at walmart.
Love the size. It's easy to see everything. Function is very easy. Does more than I expected. Would recommend especially for older folks with poor eyesight like me.
the oled screen is amazing. the camera is great. over all its definitely an ideal android phone to want// have

reviews.title: Fantastic Phone, Bad walmart service.
reviews.review_text: Overall the phone is fantastic! Couldnt be any more happy with it. However, the nightmare os with Walmart itself, especially ordering offline and the device wasn't scanned properly so, it needed to be returned and a new one bought and scanned properly before I could activate it through straight talk.

reviews.title: A35 Galaxy
reviews.review_text: I don't like that I can't stop galaxy notifications for "products". Also, the battery does not last as long as I think a new one should. I set up the clock on AOD for overnight from an 80% battery & it was down to 51% the next morning??? Other than those I like it.

I ordered a SmartTalk phone. It arrived same day, very fast. In trying to get it activated, I was told that I physically had to take it to a Walmart so they could properly scan it. Totally negates the need to have it delivered. If I knew that I had to go to Walmart in person anyway, I never would have had it delivered.,

reviews.title: Online order phones will not be activated!
reviews.review_text: The phone itself is fine, but you guys really need to figure out the online ordering process. Why offer an online only deal and then when I come to pick it up, you dont scan the box so I can't activate the phone? This has happened twice now. And this time I specifically asked the girl who gave me my order if it was scanned! She gave me a blank stare and said if I have a problem I could come back. I dont want to have to come back! I'm asking you all to do your job! Sure enough I had to come back and get it activated. Thanks for wasting my time.

reviews.title: Walmarts fault for activating
reviews.review_text: I purchased this phone for my mom, her old phone quit working suddenly. I live 3 hours away from her, so I placed a curbside order for her to pick up her new phone near where she's at. I read the reviews after purchasing and I was in such instant regret, ‚ÄúWalmart didn't scan the phone properly to activate‚Äù sure enough it happened to my mom. She put her SIM card in and service works. However through straight talk she can't activate it on her account, Walmart didn't scan it properly and it's considered ‚Äúlocked‚Äù she has to call straight talk back to send an email to unlock it and register it on her account. The rep explained that when she sends an email they will unlock it because they can confirm Walmart tried to scan it and something went wrong. Pictures are my moms text messages explaining what's going on

reviews.title: Buy in the physical store, do not buy online!
reviews.review_text: I purchased this online. The phone was shipped without being properly scanned at a register, so Straight Talk will not activate. I have been with Straight Talk since 2011 and have put up with some poor service for the cheap rate. But I have wasted 3 weeks on the last purchase and 3 weeks with this purchase trying to switch my number to the new phone, and this time it looks like I have to buy a whole new phone in a physical store at the increased price. Awesome. Not really.

reviews.title: Worst customer service EVER
reviews.review_text: I have this exact phone and love it!! However I bought another one and did not go to activate it for a couple of months when I did Straight talk said the phone was not registered to them even though it is in a strait talk box and both the ime%23 on the phone and on the red packet provided in the phone details match so I went back to Walmart and they would not help me at all so aggravating I spend a lot of money with Walmart in sore and over the App to be just told sorry nothing we can do. It was obvious this phone had never been used all the protective stickers were still on the phone and it was not like I was asking for my money back just an exchange for a phone that could be activated like I had already paid for

reviews.title: Dont buy as pick up or delivery. Wont be scanned
reviews.review_text: this is the 2nd phone i have hought through the app that was not scanned coorectly at the store and can not be activated. I cant switch my service to it. i can't activate it with a new phone number and service card. The only thing i can donia return it to the store, again.

reviews.title: Third Party Sellers Are Horrible
reviews.review_text: These third party sellers are horrible. This is the second time I've ordered a Straight Talk phone through them and they sent a non straight talk phone. If you're going to go with Straight Talk, go right to Walmart and buy it there. Plus at least it'll be scanned right so you do have to go back to the store to get it unlocked.

reviews.title: Review for the Samsung Galaxy A35
reviews.review_text: This phone is amazing. Great picture quality, great clarity and sound when it comes to the speaker. It's a huge upgrade from the Samsung Galaxy A13. So many extra features compared to the A13. The memory, ram and battery life is awesome. Great phone without breaking the bank. 5 stars.

Phone was never activated by the store. Straight talk told me they could activate it but it only activated certain features. Most of my apps I use, even simple ones like Microsoft for email im told the app is not compatible with the phone. Im told to contact the software developer for that like they really have anything to do with it. Walmart wont help since all my information is already on the phone, no luck with Straight Talk, and Samsung wouldnt help either. Completely lost my money on this purchase.

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.review_text: I was hesitant To buy this phone because some of the reviews said that they had issues with activating it because it wasn't scanned at the store and they ordered online. But I had no problem with mine. Thank the Lord! It's a bit bigger than my old phone But the picture quality is better. The sound is great. It was To transfer everything over. So far so good!

reviews.title: Do not order online . But in store.
reviews.review_text: Do not order online. All reviews are correct.Phone was not scanned. Had to drive to Walmart, return phone and then repurchase the phone in store. Save time and just pickup in store. Phone itself is great bargain @ $149.00. Love it . Feels premium.

reviews.title: Easy for the not so tec savvy phone user
reviews.review_text: I broke my other Galaxy phone so after 5 years I got this one. Pretty much easy to use and not too difficult at all to maneuver around in, it is very close to my last phone.

reviews.title: never received
reviews.review_text: The only reason I'm givin this 1 star is cause i never received this item. And I'm still wondering if I'm gonna receive my money back since I didn't get it
Phone was activated when it arrived now i have to go to town to take it back and get it activated. Bad part is is that it was delivered from the store itself and still not activated
had to take it to a Walmart store. return it and turn around and repurchase it just to get it scanned so I could activate it. and my case I ordered is gosh knows where

reviews.title: a different kind of good
reviews.review_text: great phone kinda feels loke a step down from my Motorola but its very functional. i feel like its not as tough as they claim but i jad a rugged military type phone before so maybe im the wrog person to judge.

reviews.title: Great android phone
reviews.review_text: Love the expandable sd card 1tb storage, and the long lasting 5000 mah battery. Cameras are fantastic. The Ram plus memory is a must, and the dolby stereo. Thank you! This is a great phone!!!

i really like how much you can customize samsung phones. free wallpapers, themes, and icons all on the samsung store. it charges in less than an hour %26 lasts for days. i will always buy samsung brand, their so reliable.

reviews.title: Nice but too complicated
reviews.review_text: Not a bad phone. Way too complicated with all the variables in the Settings. Don't need all the bells and whistles. Annoying that some things automatically start or stop. Need a guide book to get through all the options. Photos aren't as true to color on the A35 camera as they were on the Galaxy S8. Haven't had this one long enough to figure out the cameras. Need a manual.

This phone is a definite upgrade from my A13 5g! It runs better, feels better, and looks better! The only thing I don't like is that there is no headphone jack. So, you'll definitely need a good pair of wireless earphones, but overall totally worth it!

because walmarts website says the a35 phone has wireless charging. so i bought a charger. got home and it dont charge. went to straight talk and the a35 is not wireless charging capable. false advertizing on walmarts part. so now i either keep the charger or make yet another trip to town. i hate rice lake wisconsin walmart. i hope someone from corperate contacts me. because im ****.

item was ordered online and wasn't properly scanned before sent out to our residence! Wasnt able to properly Activate because of this ! had to return back to store . Walmart was very caring about the return other than that üôÑ i dont suggest ordering online for electronics !

reviews.title: Phone was never scanned after placing order online
reviews.review_text: Purchased phone for a Xmas present for my wife, we never had a chance to enjoy it because it wasn't scan properly by Walmart thus unusable and could not get placed Activated on straight talk for service, which cost me a lot of time money and patience. I'm very disappointed

reviews.title: Great phone for price. Plenty of storage and memor
reviews.review_text: This phone has sufficient memory to hold all my apps which is a lot. It moves quickly to open and operate everything. The transition was tough because of all the new game and free apps pre loaded. I had to uninstall a dozen or more games that I did not want. Plus the lock screen requires that you hit OK to open after the pin. I cannot find a way to auto open after in putting the pin. Overall, I love this phone compared to all the prior models.

reviews.title: frustrated with walmart not product
reviews.review_text: i don't know because after paying extra for express delivery and tipping the driver really well i still had to go to store to return phone as it was unactivatable because it was not scanned correctly also told by all 5 employees i was transferred to on phone that this happens alot. suggestion don't offer prepaid phones on delivery site if its not going to work when customer receives it.

reviews.title: Walmart gave my mother a headache for Christmas!
reviews.review_text: This phone was a Christmas gift for my mother. I tried to purchase it in store to avoid problems, but it said in store pick up was not available and that it would have to be delivered. Now we cannot seem to get it up and running because after being on the phone with straight talk for about an hour, it was determined that the phone had not gotten scanned!?! That it is showing that it still belongs to Walmart. Now they want my 80 yr. old mother to print the receipt and send them a copy. I will be taking her to the Walmart that I purchased it from to try to get it resolved tomorrow. Not a very merry Christmas experience at all. I feel like I gave her a headache for Christmas.

reviews.title: Great Phone
reviews.review_text: This phone is awesome. I can't believe how fast it runs. The picture quality is really good. The price is great. Setting up and transferring data was a breeze.

reviews.title: Samsung phone through Straight Talk
reviews.review_text: This was a terrible purchase. Phone is locked to Straight Talk. Phone is NOT scanned at point of sale. There is only a 14 day return policy. I have been going in circles with Straight Talk who refuses to unlock the phone despite the fact I am a paid up existing account holder for more than six years. Six weeks later I still don't have a functioning phone!

reviews.title: Troublesome
reviews.review_text: Ordered 2 phones. One had a little trouble getting activated but I couldn't activate the other. Whomever scanned it didn't do it properly. I took it to the closest supercenter and they gave me 3 options. Try to scan it there to see if that would work, return it for a refund, or just replace it. I chose to refund it and get one myself from the electronics section. Made sure the person behind the counter scanned both codes and that it was all good. Going to call straight talk to set it up soon. If it doesn't work then it might be on straight talks end.
would love a refund peace of garbage phone took 3 weeks to get it active becuse walmart only scaned one code

reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy A 35
reviews.review_text: This phone is great.. very easy to get use too, if you have already used Samsung phones before. Alot of good features.

reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy A35
reviews.review_text: I'm enjoying my phone, though I'm having problems finding a good case for it. I've ordered 2 and neither one fits

reviews.review_text: Everything has went good with everything switching over to my new phone. Still getting used to everything that the phone does. Have never really needed a nice phone until now and everything has went good.

The phone was a reasonable price the activation process was quick and easy you can do everything through the app even a return or refund.

reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy A35

the phone was fine however it was not compatible and could not be activated the phone is on its way back to the store for a refund Spectrum was the source of information

reviews.title: Worst phone in the world

Doesn't work outside inside if it's to bright lird forbid I have an emergency cause it will not I literally have to put my hand over it and type in code at same time and you know it's bad when the phone company won't take it back and your still making payments

reviews.title: Snafu
reviews.review_text: This order was a snafu from the very beginning. None of the stores had the phone I wanted, so I had to have it shipped. The order was processed promptly and shipped via Fedex. Fedex only had to deliver the package 3 hours away but some how lost the package and the shipment was delayed for 24 hours. I finally got the shipment then attempted to activate the phone but could not because apparently the Walmart in Spring Hill forgot to scan the phone before they shipped it, so therefore I could not activate it and had to return it to a local Walmart. Walmart Help was very nice about everything and gave me a 25% off coupon so blah on Spring Hill Wally World and Yay for Walmart Help.

reviews.title: Love this phone
reviews.review_text: I love this phone! It has adequate storage for everything that I need does everything and that I needed to do I love the security features and so far it's been practically indestructible I have a two-year-old that loves to grab my phone every chance he gets and whenever I try to get it back from him he loves to throw it and it hasn't even cracked the screen it's honestly one of the best phones I've ever had

reviews.title: Nice phone, poor customer service
reviews.review_text: The phone seems nice but the experience has been pretty bad. The phone has been an expensive paperweight since it arrived. Apparently they don't scan the barcode when it ships from the warehouse (like they do at the store) so it isn't "eligible" to be activated. Multiple conversations with Straight Talk customer service have not resolved the issue. They opened a ticket and then promptly closed the ticket without addressing it. When I call they tell me to disregard the ticket status, but can't provide a current status or any resolution. I suggest saving yourself the trouble - DO NOT purchase a Straight Talk phone directly through the Walmart.com site.
